definition: auspicious day/good day/happy life
good/well/proper/good to/easy to/very/so/(suffix indicating completion or readiness)/(of two people) close/on intimate terms/(after a personal pronoun) hello
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: But daylight is not necessarily a pleasant experience either.
sentences.chinese: 不過，白天也不一定有好日子過。

sentences.english: Raise a toast to a good day.
sentences.chinese: 爲一個好日子舉杯祝酒。

sentences.english: I told you there would be better days.
sentences.chinese: 我告訴過你，好日子是會有的。

sentences.english: The creamofthe crop is a good step by step closer to me.
sentences.chinese: 百裏挑一的好日子正一步一步地向我靠近。

sentences.english: There's a good day of multi-functional snack car.
sentences.chinese: 旗下有好好日子多功能小喫車。

sentences.english: But any hope of a decent life there depends on peace.
sentences.chinese: 但是，一切對好日子的期許都需依靠和平。

sentences.english: "Tomorrow is going to be a good day with this current, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “看這海流，明兒會是個好日子，”他說。

sentences.english: We finally have a good day, grandma can enjoy several years of good luck.
sentences.chinese: 咱們終於過上好日子了，奶奶也能享幾年好福了。

sentences.english: But this source of liquidity may be near exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 但好日子不長了，資金源已經接近枯竭。

sentences.english: In the evening we went to eat rice noodles had a good day.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我們去喫米粉，過了好日子。

sentences.english: What the data do not show is that search engines have had their day.
sentences.chinese: 數據未予體現的是，搜索引擎的好日子已經到來。

sentences.english: Wieden said. "Well, the good old days were never as good as this last year."
sentences.chinese: 但是，過去的好日子再好也比不上過去的那一年。

sentences.english: In Mubarak's era, we never saw a good day.
sentences.chinese: 在穆巴拉克時代，我們從來沒有過好日子。

sentences.english: She prated of the good old days.
sentences.chinese: 喋喋不休地談過去的好日子。

sentences.english: Thought, and Simon, played by Mr. Lee married to Hong Kong would have a good day.
sentences.chinese: 以爲和任達華飾演的李先生結婚去香港會有好日子。

definition: hard times
day/a (calendar) date/days of one's life
to the end (of)/at the end of/in the end/to come to an end
simple life
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
hopes/good prospects
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
to break clear of all the troubles and hardships/to achieve success/to make it
to have an easy time/(feel) well
lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
How are you getting by?/How's life?/contraction of 過得去|过得去, can get by/tolerably well/not too bad
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
